snippet: Ally Financial, known as GMAC Financial when it was bailed out for $17 billion, could be harmed if its mortgage unit files for bankruptcy as expected.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column observes Ally Financial, known as GMAC Financial when it was bailed out for $17 billion, could be harmed if its mortgage unit Residential Capital files for bankruptcy as expected; notes for the moment, depositors and creditors of Ally seem relatively unfazed; points out that Ally, which is still 74 percent taxpayer owned following the bailout, will almost certainly have to write a check to escape this mess, and the only question is how big the check will have to be. (M)
lead_paragraph: WHEN General Motors was bailed out, the government sank $17 billion of taxpayers' money into G.M.'s troubled finance arm, GMAC. Three years on, we're still waiting for the payback.
